Class TextViewImpl

java.lang.Object
  com.google.wave.api.impl.TextViewImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
TextView
public class TextViewImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements TextView

TextView implementation.

Author:
scovitz@google.com (Seth Covitz), mprasetya@google.com (Marcel Prasetya)

Method Detail

insert

public void insert(int start,
                   java.lang.String text)
Description copied from interface: TextView
Inserts text at the given starting position within the document. If the text is inserted into a range that is surrounded completely by an annotation, the annotation will be extended to include the inserted text.

Specified by:
insert in interface TextView
Parameters:
start - The starting index in the text document.
text - The text to be inserted.

append

public void append(java.lang.String text)
Description copied from interface: TextView
Appends text to the end of document. Any annotations that extend to the end of the document will not be extended to include this text.

Specified by:
append in interface TextView
Parameters:
text - the text to be appended.

appendMarkup

public void appendMarkup(java.lang.String content)
Description copied from interface: TextView
Appends text containing XHTML markup to the end of the document. Any white-listed and supported HTML tags will be converted into the proper annotations and conform to the wave XML schema. Anything unsupported will be ignored. For example, foo will result in "foo" to be set as bold but the "f" tag to be ignored. NB: The local state annotations and elements will not be reflected locally and only text is set. The state will be correct upon the next incoming event bundle.

Specified by:
appendMarkup in interface TextView
Parameters:
content - Text string containing markup and text.

delete

public void delete(Range range)
Description copied from interface: TextView
Deletes the text bounded by the specified range. All annotations and entities that are wholly contained within this range will also be deleted. Annotations that overlap this range will be truncated accordingly.

Specified by:
delete in interface TextView
Parameters:
range - the range over the document affected by this operation.

delete

public void delete()
Description copied from interface: TextView
Deletes all text and annotations for this document. Deleting text will also delete any entities that have been inserted between characters in the text.

Specified by:
delete in interface TextView

Returns the text content for this document.

the text content for this document.

replace

public void replace(java.lang.String text)
Description copied from interface: TextView
Replaces all of the text and annotations in the document with the given text. This is equivalent to the two operations, deleteText() and appendText() and affects existing annotations and entities accordingly.

Specified by:
replace in interface TextView
Parameters:
text - The new text to be added to the document.

replace

public void replace(Range range,
                    java.lang.String text)
Description copied from interface: TextView
Replaces the text content bounded by the specified range with the given text. This is equivalent to the two operations, delete(Range) and insert(start) and affects existing annotations accordingly to these operations.

Specified by:
replace in interface TextView
Parameters:
range - The range over the document affected by this operation.
text - The new text that will replace the previous text.

appendStyledText

public void appendStyledText(StyledText styledText)
Description copied from interface: TextView
Appends the given styled text as text and annotations to the end of the document.

Specified by:
appendStyledText in interface TextView
Parameters:
styledText - the styled text to be appended.

insertStyledText

public void insertStyledText(int start,
                             StyledText styledText)
Description copied from interface: TextView
Inserts the styled text as text and annotations at the given position within the text document. Existing annotations that surround the insertion point will be extended to include the new text.

Specified by:
insertStyledText in interface TextView
Parameters:
start - the position within the document to insert the new text.
styledText - the styled text to be inserted.

replaceStyledText

public void replaceStyledText(Range range,
                              StyledText styledText)
Description copied from interface: TextView
Replaces the text bounded by the specified range with the styled text as text and annotations. This is the equivalent to the two operations, deleteText(Range) and insertStyledText(start) and affects existing annotations and entities accordingly.

Specified by:
replaceStyledText in interface TextView
Parameters:
range - The range over the document which is affected by this operation.
styledText - The text to be inserted into the document.

replaceStyledText

public void replaceStyledText(StyledText styledText)
Description copied from interface: TextView
Replaces all of the text in the document with the given styled text as text and annotations. This is equivalent to the two operations, deleteText() and appendStyledText() and affects existing annotations and entities accordingly.

Specified by:
replaceStyledText in interface TextView
Parameters:
styledText - The text to become the content for the document.

deleteAnnotations

public void deleteAnnotations(Range range)
Description copied from interface: TextView
Deletes all annotations from the given range. Any annotation wholly contained within this range will be deleted. Annotations that overlap this range will be truncated at the edges of the range.

Specified by:
deleteAnnotations in interface TextView
Parameters:
range - the range over which all annotations should be deleted.

deleteElement in interface TextView
Parameters:
index - the position of the element to delete.

                           Element element)
